newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean won ends higher on intervention worries.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean won ends higher on intervention worries.

text.p: The won closed stronger versus the dollar on Wednesday as fears of a central bank intervention froze dollar buying sentiment, dealers said.
The won closed at 877.30 after opening at 878.80. It traded in a range of 876.40 to 879.10.
Dealers said the local unit's sharp fall this week has prompted talks of possible intervention.
Moreover, inflow of foreign funds for equity investment in the Seoul bourse also heightened the won's demand, they said.
"The dollar is likely to fall to the 875 won level before rebounding due to heavy dollar positions," said one local bank dealer.
"The dollar could be kept at the 880 won level until the end of March with the central bank intervening once or twice," he added.
The dollar has surged more than nine won this week on the back of growing import deals and speculative buying.
Dealers said the won was expected to move in a range of 876.50 to 879.50 on Thursday with the base mid-rate at 877.80. Today's mid rate was pegged at 877.70.
